title: The Ant and the Elephant
description: In “The Ant and the Elephant,” celebrated author and illustrator Bill Peet crafts a heartwarming fable that underscores the virtues of kindness and reciprocity. The narrative unfolds in a vibrant jungle setting, where a series of animals—including a turtle, hornbill, giraffe, lion, and rhino—find themselves in predicaments but refuse to assist one another. It is the benevolent elephant who selflessly aids each creature in turn. When the elephant later becomes trapped in a ravine, it is the tiny ant, leading a multitude of fellow ants, who orchestrates his rescue, demonstrating that even the smallest among us can make a monumental difference. Peet’s engaging illustrations and rhythmic prose make this 48-page picture book a delightful read for children aged 4 to 7, imparting timeless lessons on empathy and the power of collective effort.
author: Bill Peet
